data.title: Someday, maybe?
data.text:
Our daughter and her husband heard this "new" Old Town was worth a visit. Sadly, this place has not become anything to get excited about. There are more bars than shops open. And, there are more unopened spaces than open ones.
It seems the places were not planned, just allowed in to fill a space.

data.title: Thursday is a great day to test the Pizza and Beer at great prices!
data.text: Thursday evening is the greatest time to be there for the discounted food and drinks. The Pizza was the thinest crust anywhere we have seen in the Sacramento/Roseville area. The kitchen is willing to create anything you might want in choice of pizza. The Large salad is big enough for two to share. The small pizza worked for us. We had the bruschetta pizza for the vegans in the group and ordered a combination for the meat eaters.  We had a special pizza made with blue cheese, chicken, pepperoni, black olives with a creamy garlic sauce that prompted taking advantage of the $3.00 pints of Shock Top and Sierra Nevada; a Thursday special item along with small pizzas at $8.00 each. A great 2+ hours of talk, eat and enjoy. It can be cold and noisy if the trains are running outside, but we didn't have any problem talking over the noise of each other or the trains.
